item.title: [Python] Prepare a pseudo API server using GitHub Actions
item.description: ## Introduction Perhaps recently, a feature called GitHub Actions has been added. This is the one that can fire certain Actions (shell script executions) for certain events. For example, it is a function for so-called CI/CD that builds when PR of dev branch is merged and pushes it to dev-pages branch. At this time, I participated in the COVID-19 countermeasure site Hokkaido version, which is currently a big move, and developed using this function.

item.title: [Python] I tried a visual regression test on GitHub Pages
item.description: #Motivation Hello @glassmonkey. CI is Github Action. Since I wanted to try using images if I did CI, I tried a visual regression test easily. I made it in a rush, so I would appreciate any feedback. #What is a visual regression test? The explanation on Astamuse-sama’s blog was easy to understand, so I will quote it. The visual regression test is a visual regression test, specifically a test that takes a screenshot and extracts the differences.

item.title: [Python] Automated test of Pipenv + Pytest with Github Actions
item.description: # Overview Last time, I performed an automatic test using Travis CI in “I did an automated test of Pipenv + Pytest with Travis CI”,but[GithubActions]((https://help.github.com/ja/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/about-github-actions) is now available, so I tried it here as well. The repositories that I actually tried are as follows. https://github.com/doara-developer/weatherlib Github Actions CI/CD tool on Github. It’s still in beta now, but soon will be standard support. Available by sending Beta Participation Request. In my case, I went there a few days after applying.
